name: Oven-Baked Salmon with Hoisin and Plum Sauce
author: Buon Appetito
summary: I came up with this oven-baked recipe to get my kids to enjoy salmon. My kids are not exactly salmon lovers but this worked.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, divided, or to taste
1 (2 inch) piece fresh ginger, or to taste, peeled and diced
1 (1 pound) filleted side of salmon, skin removed
freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon unsalted butter, or more to taste
1 tablespoon rice vinegar, or to taste
2 tablespoons chicken broth, or more as needed
3  scallions, chopped, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Heat 1/2 of the oil in a skillet over medium heat
Cook and stir 1/2 of the garlic and ginger until softened, 3 to 5 minutes
Remove from heat and cool for 10 minutes
Grease a baking pan with the remaining oil
Season salmon with salt and pepper and place in the baking pan
Rub cooled garlic and ginger over the salmon
Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes
While the salmon is baking, prepare the hoisin-plum sauce
Melt butter in the skillet; cook and stir remaining garlic and ginger until softened, 3 to 5 minutes
Add rice vinegar and let it cook off
Add oyster sauce and chile paste; bring to a simmer
Stir in hoisin and plum sauces and bring back to a simmer
Pour in chicken broth to loosen up sauce to a lighter consistency
Cover salmon with the sauce and continue baking until flesh flakes easily with a fork, 5 to 6 minutes more
